episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the ornamental history of tomatoes in England, NASA's ambitious plans to give the moon a moon, the unusual wartime activities of Sherlock Holmes actor Basil Rathbone, and Abraham Lincoln's use of his top hat for storing important documents.

facts.fact: For 200 years after tomatoes made it to England, they were grown almost entirely for ornamental reasons.
NASA is planning on giving the moon a moon.
The man who played Sherlock Holmes spent the First World War dressed as a tree.
Abraham Lincoln used his stovepipe hat to keep important documents hidden.
